cell.html: Elected as a Liberal, expelled from caucus in November 2006
cell.text: Elected as a Liberal, expelled from caucus in November 2006

cell.html: Succeeded Ralph Klein in a by-election June 12, 2007.
cell.text: Succeeded Ralph Klein in a by-election June 12, 2007.

cell.html: Succeeded Shirley McClellan in a by-election June 12, 2007.
cell.text: Succeeded Shirley McClellan in a by-election June 12, 2007.

cell.html: Resigned as Premier December 14, 2006 and from legislature January 15, 2007; succeeded by Craig Cheffins as MLA for Calgary Elbow and by Ed Stelmach as Premier.
cell.text: Resigned as Premier December 14, 2006 and from legislature January 15, 2007; succeeded by Craig Cheffins as MLA for Calgary Elbow and by Ed Stelmach as Premier.

cell.html: Resigned November 2007; seat left vacant until the 2008 election
cell.text: Resigned November 2007; seat left vacant until the 2008 election
Resigned January 15 2007, succeeded by Jack Hayden .

cell.html: Suspended from P.C. caucus March 22, 2006; re-admitted July 25, 2006.
cell.text: Suspended from P.C. caucus March 22, 2006; re-admitted July 25, 2006.

context.text: 26th Alberta Legislative Assembly - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

The members of the 26th Legislature were elected in the 26th Alberta general election held on November 22 , 2004 . In the list below, cabinet members' names are bolded; leaders of official parties are italicized.
